name: polycarbonate production | polycarbonate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1121/documentation

The dataset represents the production of polycarbonate (PC), a polymer composed of identical units of bisphenol A. PC is a strong, ductile, thermally stable, transparent, flame-resistant thermoplastic polymer. Thanks to these characteristics it is widely used in buildings, electrical appliances, and electronics, automotive, packaging, medical devices, etc. Polycarbonate can be worked with traditional extrusion and injection moulding (PlasticsEurope 2019).;Reference:;PlasticsEurope, 2019.Polycarbonate (PC), Eco-profiles and Environmental Product Declaration of the European Plastics Manufacturers Available at: https://www.plasticseurope.org/en/resources/eco-profiles

The activity starts when Bisphenol reaches the production plant. The process includes input materials, energy consumption, water consumption, production infrastructure, end-of-life as well as air and water emissions.

The activity ends with polycarbonate ready to be supplied in the market.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2013:Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Polycarbonate is produced via a interfacial polycondesation. Bisphenol A is treated with sodium hydroxide, the resulting diphenoxide reacts with phosgene. The assumed reaction efficiency is of 98%.;Material inputs for the reaction are calculated stoichiometrically. Energy requirements are sourced from Mooij and Muller, 2021. Water use is based on PlasticsEurope, 2019. ;Reference: ;Mooij and Muller, 2021. Decarbonisation options for the Dutch polycarbonate industry, PBL Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency, TNO Available at: https://www.pbl.nl/sites/default/files/downloads/pbl-2021-decarbonisation-options-for-the-dutch-polycarbonate-industry-4580.pdf;PlasticsEurope, 2019.Polycarbonate (PC), Eco-profiles and Environmental Product Declaration of the European Plastics Manufacturers Available at: https://www.plasticseurope.org/en/resources/eco-profiles
